request-2525.tweet: Well, perfection has been achieved, the trash guitar is repaired.It was a little more complicated than I had hoped.I ended up going to a music store after all. He recommended to throw it away, but I was set on repairing it. He did not have a mechanic that would fit. The hole distance was OK, but his mechanics were all 10 mm diameter but the guitar holes were 9 mm. Not only that, the pegs were too long. So he drilled the holes larger and handed me the mechanic and told me to saw it off.

request-2904.tweet: Continued with the second #PCB, the #synthesizer #shield.The only things I changed were adding a socket for the #OpAmp and JST connector for the speaker.I oversaw that this caused problems with the cardboard case, so I had to cut some holes. request-2905.tweet: #soldering project this weekend: #Arduino Make Your Uno kit: https://makeyouruno.arduino.cc/Today, I soldered the #ArduinoUno board. Next will be the synthesizer shield.It was fun and everything is labeled on the silkscreen.#solderingkit #electronics #atmega #usbc

request-2907.tweet: Small #soldering excercise: a #discrete #NE555 timer built with #SMD #transistor.I tried it out on my #breadboard and verified it with my #oscilloscope.#electronics

request-2908.tweet: I finally #fixed my #Commodore #VC1541 by replacing all the crappy IC sockets!I checked every connection against the #schematics and noticed a few higher resistance values when measuring at the IC pins - still low enough to beep, though.They were very cheap sockets with only one-sided connections, which can result in poor connection.After swapping them (#unsoldering and #soldering 256 pins), it works like a charm. Very quiet purring since I cleaned the mechanics, too.#retrocomputing #repair

request-2909.tweet: Some more progress on the #Commodore #VC1541 today.The #alignment from the diagnostics looks okay so far.But when trying the performance test, it gets stuck at the "formatting" stage. The red LED lights, but the spindle motor doesn't start.When trying the "fast format", the spindle motor starts, but the red LED doesn't light up.Both programs, and any other from the diagnostic, seem to freeze until I switch the drive off, resulting in a "device not present" error or similar.#retrocomputing

request-2910.tweet: To make absolutely sure that the 6502 #processor is defective, I built a #NOP test #circuit on a #breadboard with a 100kHz #NE555 clock and a couple of LEDs on the address lines.A known working 6502 looks fine, I can clearly see the higher address lines counting up (I accidentally inverted the LEDs).The one from the 1541 doesn't show any activity. Only address lines A0 to A3 look normal on the oscilloscope.#retrocomputing

request-2911.tweet: Some progress with the #Commodore #VC1541 - I added the reset bodge, socketed a few logic chips, and turned it on.At first, the drive was spinning constantly, but all the logic signals looked fine, including the reset signal.I then swapped the 6502 from a working 1541-II, and it worked again.Now, I have a few mechanical issues. An inserted #floppy is thrown out again most times, and the tray doesn't latch in closed position easily.#retrocomputing #Alps #floppydrive #repair

request-2912.tweet: It was a success. After receiving a working 3.5" #floppy drive, it passed all diagnostics and wrote the disks. Now I only need another drive for putting into my #Amiga 500.#retrocomputing #floppydisk #Arduino

request-2913.tweet: I took the #commodore #1541 completely apart, removed rust, and reassembled the power #transformer part. It shows 16.9 and 10.6 Volts without load. Maybe I'll change it to a modern switching PSU, too.The read head and motors show reasonable resistance values, so it should work.The #74LS14 looks a bit dirty, I will give it a good clean and replace the dirty socket.It is a rev B board, but without the reset fix shown in the manual, so I might add it, too.#retrocomputing #repair

request-2914.tweet: Finished building the DrawBridge.It seems to work, but I need to connect an external 5V power supply, since my laptop doesn't provide enough voltage to power the drive.Also, this #floppy drive was old, and makes squeaky noises when trying to write. The inserted floppy shows scratch markings, too.So, I'll need a proper floppy drive.#Amiga #floppydrive #soldering #perfboard #ArduinoNano #Arduino

request-2915.tweet: I decided to build a DrawBridge, an #Arduino #Amiga #Floppy Disk Reader/Writer, see here: https://amiga.robsmithdev.co.uk/For this, I bought a genuine #ArduinoNano and will use one of my old PC floppy drives.First step was #soldering the CTS pin of the #SMD #FTDI chip to pin A2. This was a challenge because I didn't want to unsolder the pin headers which might've made it easier.So, I used an enameled copper wire and fiddled it through a via.No shorts, and least the diagnostic shows it works.

request-2916.tweet: Today, the replacement belts for my #Commodore #Datasette arrived. They were a bit loose and stiff. Other than that, they looked fine after cleaning them.Now, they work again. The tapes get loaded and the programs run. Now I can test the tapes I received with them.I have a two more, a 1531 for C16, but since I don't have a C16 or an adaptor, I can't teat it, and an aftermarket one that seems to need a few more replacement parts.#repair #retrocomputer #retrocomputing #cassette #C64

request-3251.tweet: In #Dropserver I've made it so that each appspace (an instance of an app) can be backed up and downloaded, right from the UI (see image). request-3531.tweet: Graph 3Ô∏è‚É£: In relation to the entire German car fleet, purely electric vehicles still play a very small role at around 3%. In order to replace the large existing fleet of petrol and diesel cars, electric vehicles simply need to grow much faster. This is all the more true as the entire German car fleet still tends to be growing.

request-3532.tweet: Graph 2Ô∏è‚É£: The total number of purely battery-electric vehicles in Germany currently stands at around 1.56 million. That is just over 10% of the target of 15 million for 2030. The gap between the current trend and the target path is widening - and this applies not only compared to a linear growth path (which seems not very realistic here), but also to a logistical growth path that increases over time.

request-3533.tweet: Graph 1Ô∏è‚É£: The share of pure BEV in monthly new registrations was 13.7% in August, largely similar as in previous months. request-3562.tweet: Barn find batteries. Both at 10.4V, so not happy.This Exide VRLA is toast, someone broke it open and destroyed the valve assembly, then wasted an entire roll of PVC tape trying to bandage it up.Fun fact: Battery acid does a decent job of freshening up old looking wood.The other is a FLA type, all cells watered and accepting charge without heating up, so there's hope. We shall see in the morning.#DIY #Battery #LeadAcid #AGM #FLA #Repair #Tape #BarnFind

request-3563.tweet: Things one finds under the strimmer.Four old vibration pumps. Probably should get at least one working spare, there being so many old ones probably means they break regularly.#DIY #Repair #Pump #Homestead

request-3564.tweet: Got this thing working. Just needed a little tickling of the spark plug connector.Some parts missing, but runs fine. And it's a nice fuel efficient and less stinky 4-stroke Honda.Cleaned up the nettle jungle under the storks nest while the storks are on holiday in Sardinia or wherever they go.Then cut a path through the overgrown orchard. Mostly apple trees, and a few more old bee houses. Lots more cleanup needed there. And pruning.#Homestead #Strimer #DIY #Gardening #Cleanup

request-3565.tweet: Sometimes I get thermometers that show temperature and also some weird other stuff that makes no sense and I have to fix them.#Temperature #Thermometer #Celsius #Fahrenheit #Metric #DIY #FixedIt

request-3566.tweet: Soviet phone socket. Seems to contain a lightbulb?! And two 1A fuses.No tone, but it's not disconnected, something pulses a ~40V spike every now and then.The fuses connect each input wire to the residential outlet. The lightbulb doesn't seem to be connected to anything, but has those two screws to connect it across the copper pair, presumably for testing purposes. Those 40V spikes would make it flash. It's normally under an opaque cover.Interesting.#Soviet #POTS #Telephony #Socket

request-3568.tweet: Todays #homestead achievement: Heat the sauna entirely from wood scraps found leaning on the walls of various sheds.Slowly cleaning up the place, little by little. Plastic goes in the recycling, rotten wood in the compost, sketchy wood in the sauna oven, good wood is stored, metal gets sorted and trees freed of bits of string and wire, as far as it hasn't grown in yet.Found a head under one of the wood scraps outside. Impaled it on a fence post, as you do.#Head #Fence #Cleanup #BarnFind

request-3569.tweet: Pried the nailed on shutters off the wall and nailed them over the insulation filled window. They actually still fit.They had latches for holding them open, but I guess maybe they rattled in a storm and someone got fed up and nailed them to the wall.Not sure we really need shutters. Half are missing anyways. We're not in Florida, although who knows what the new climate will bring. Maybe everyone needs shutters.#Windows #DIY #Homestead #Shutter #LogHouse

request-3570.tweet: Nobody needs two north facing windows in a bedroom. Unless they had whale oil lamps, which probably was the case when the house was built.So one got sealed off. When we do the rest of the windows, I plan to close the gap with logs, but for now it's 10cm insulation between the original glass panes, foam strips and caulking.Will caulk the outside tomorrow and try to close the shutters (they're nailed open).Already feels warmer :)#DIY #Homestead #House #Insulation #Windows

request-3571.tweet: Broke into barn #4 today, because the lock was rusted shut. Army basic training taught me how to open a padlock with two entrenching tools. In a pinch, two hammers work fine.To my disappointment, no fourth tractor trailer (aww!), but more firewood, some old planks and a very busted woodworking bench!Nice wooden screws on that, might be able to restore/reuse those.Oh, and Mr. Badger had a nest here apparently.Also, rotten sticks. Sticks everywhere.#Homestead #Woodworking #Barn #Farm

request-3572.tweet: Recycled some salvaged panels from broken MDF furniture into shelves for the intact MDF furniture.Some day I'll get around to making nice furniture, but this will have to do for now.Gathered the icky MDF sawdust, it's no good for compost, only for combined cycle power plants. Which is where the "recycling" bins go. Not sure which one, Vilnius or Elektrenai probably.First time using the extended fence, very useful.#DIY #Furniture #MDF #Recycling #ReUse #TableSaw #Woodworking #Homestead

request-3574.tweet: Aliexpress is now offering me cars and houses.Probably quite the shipping fee on the latter.#AliExpress #China #Internetshopping #House #Car

request-3575.tweet: Also got a doorbell. Made a little housing for it with a piece from the zinc scrap pile.The wireless doorbell is pretty clever: Instead of using a battery and finding out it's empty because you missed a delivery, it has no battery at all. Instead, it generates enough power to squirt a radio message to the receiver from the force of the finger pushing the button to ring the bell. Clever.#DIY #Steel #Zinc #Tin #Bending #Metalworking #Homestead #Doorbell #Electronics

request-3577.tweet: Letterbox installed, which means we can now receive mail. request-3578.tweet: The #farm came with a few piles of steel like this one.Gotta sort through it at some point, see what's raw materials, what's usable equipment and what is scrap steel to recycle (or weld some artwork from).The previous owners offered to get someone to collect it (scrap steel has value). I said please leave it all :)Already found a fence post I needed to mount the letterbox on. And picked a chunk to make a grill from.#Steel #Scrap #Treasure #Homestead #Recycle
